summary.para: Contains classes and interfaces specific to the Windows Forms Chart Module functionality.
Represents the charting List Editor used in the XAF Windows Forms applications.

summary.para: Creates and initializes an instance of the class.

member.param: An object representing the Application Model‘s node, which contains information on the View that will use the instantiated List Editor.

summary.para: Gets or sets the border style for the target Chart Control.

member.value: A enumeration value specifying the border style of the target Chart Control.

member.value: A object representing the current List Editor’s control.

summary.para: Performs the required pre-export actions under the .

member.name: P:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Chart.Win.ChartListEditor.Printable

summary.para: Specifies the control to be exported via the ExportController.ExportAction.

member.value: An IPrintable object that is the control used for exporting. The default value is the ChartListEditor’s ChartListEditor.ChartControl property value.

summary.para: Occurs when the ChartListEditor’s controls are created and disposed of.

An object that can be used to manage the current application.

summary.para: Provides access to the list of export formats supported by the current Chart List Editor.

member.value: An List<> object that is a list of supported export formats.

summary.para: Returns the list of updaters that handle database updates for the module.

summary.para: Contains classes and interfaces that allow you to configure your WinForms application in the fluent API-based application builder.
Extends the interface with a method to add the Charts Module to your application.

member.name: M:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.ChartsApplicationBuilderExtensions.AddCharts(DevExpress.ExpressApp.ApplicationBuilder.IModuleBuilder{DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.IWinApplicationBuilder})

summary.para: Adds the Charts Module to your application.

member.param: Allows you to register and configure Modules in your application, and chain further Module registrations.
member.returns: Allows you to register and configure Modules in your application, and chain further Module registrations.
